Class EmbedMessageWindowController

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.hexeditor.controllers.EmbedMessageWindowController
@Component public class EmbedMessageWindowController extends Object
This controller sets up the UI for the Embed Message window. In this window, the user will be able to enter text that will be inserted into the file. The text can replace or be inserted between existing bytes, or it can be appended to the end of the file. Two checkboxes control these actions. Finally, there are two text fields in which the user can enter a row index and a column index. Both are used to calculate the file offset at which the text will be inserted. The column text field is disabled when both checkboxes are unchecked, and both text fields are disabled when the Append to end of file? checkbox is checked. If the file is already empty (i.e., there are no bytes in the file), the only action available is appending text.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the UI elements in the Embed Message window. As the user types text in the text area, feedback will be given in a label above it. Feedback will also depend on the state of the checkboxes.

      If the Replace existing bytes? checkbox is checked, the text must not run past the end of the file.

      If the Append to end of file? checkbox is checked, the sum of the number of bytes in the text and the number of existing bytes in the file must not exceed LazyHexList.MAX_LENGTH.

      If neither checkbox is checked, the number of bytes in the text must be a multiple of AppConstants.CHUNK_SIZE, and also the sum of all bytes must not exceed LazyHexList.MAX_LENGTH.
